title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.2: PUBLIC FINANCE

description.narrative: Output 3.2: By 2023, the Government and citizens have increased awareness and capacity to enhance participation, transparency, accountability, equity and quality of public investment in children., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluation, Reducing Child Poverty, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3:By 2023, all children, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender-responsive social policies for the sustainable and equitable realization of their rights.

sector.narrative: PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)
PF4C: Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: In 2021, thanks to UNICEF Lesotho support, the capacity of the government to implement the Medium Term Expenditure Framework is strengthened, and;budget transparency and participation;practices are improved.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/12/2021
